articles.description: Follow live text as Crystal Palace face Liverpool, followed by five other fixtures including Aston Villa v Arsenal in the Premier League.
articles.title: Premier League: Alisson starts for Liverpool at Crystal Palace - radio & text

articles.description: Manchester United are booed off after they suffer a 3-0 hammering at home to Bournemouth in the Premier League.
articles.title: Bournemouth stun Man Utd at Old Trafford

articles.description: Mohamed Salah scores his 200th Liverpool goal as Jurgen Klopp's side produce a late comeback against Crystal Palace to go top of the Premier League.
articles.title: Salah scores 200th Liverpool goal as Reds go top

articles.description: Follow live text updates as England face West Indies in the third and final one-day international in Bridgetown, Barbados.
articles.title: Rain frustrates West Indies and England

articles.description: Brilliant England bowl a woeful India out for just 80 to complete a comfortable T20 series win with a game to spare.
articles.title: England win T20 series as India bowled out for 80

articles.description: Stephen Curry scores 34 points for the Golden State Warriors but is unable to stop their 138-136 overtime defeat to the Oklahoma City Thunder.
articles.title: NBA: Oklahoma Thunder claim overtime win over Golden State Warriors

articles.description: Nottingham Forest manager Steve Cooper says he is proud of his team after they battled out a Premier League draw away at Wolverhampton Wanderers.
articles.title: Under pressure Cooper 'proud' as Forest draw at Wolves

articles.description: Cardiff's spirited display in the Investec Champions Cup is not enough to prevent their biggest European loss in 17 years against the five-time champions.
articles.title: Cardiff crash to seven-try defeat at Toulouse

articles.description: James McAtee's goal earns Sheffield United a much-needed victory in Chris Wilder's second game since his return to the club.
articles.title: McAtee wonder goal gives Blades win over Brentford

articles.description: Rangers move to within five points of Scottish Premiership leaders Celtic with a comeback win over Dundee despite being down to 10 men.
articles.title: 10-man Rangers beat Dundee to narrow Celtic lead
